location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 2: James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to James Henderson, Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, acknowledges a request that he endeavour to obtain and transmit information regarding attempts at slave dealing, either by British subjects or by those of other nations, which it is hoped may aid the detection and punishment of any efforts that may be made to renew the trade between Mauritius and the ports of Persia, Arabia and East Africa. Dow promises to transmit such information that he may be able to obtain.
